title: What are human rights and duties? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the ‘Age of Moral Relativism’, in a world that will soon house 8 billion humans, a meaningful question to ponder. No matter where you are from, East or West, given time on a crowded planet, increasingly more homogenous, these issues return to the teachings of old in most of cultures of the world with few or notable exceptions: Feed the hungry, tend the sick, shelter the homeless, take life only in self defense. These things are basic and humane, the duties of individuals to their tribe, nation and world. Some elites deny these simple principals; greed, the suffering or death of others is without meaning to them. It is those people who are ordering and destroying the earth, spiritually and physically. One duty is stop them in the name of humanity.

We have been given the natural capacity for recognizing the existence of polarities such as good and evil, right and wrong, good and bad. These are empty ideas until we fill them with life experiences. Very young children can feel the presence or absence of what it means to be fair. This innate capacity sets the stage for each culture to define and design their own social system of what is a right and a duty.
